Articles.Content:
It's near the 44th Anniversary of the Apollo 11 Moon Landing and I have yet to see a thread about it. Post your photos!

Here are mine:pic.twitter.com/xMHvADHBFIpic.twitter.com/szGAAFTEb4pic.twitter.com/V5FwWT05PO

wasn't the moon landing on the 20th

Which is why I was proposing a weekend landing. But this guy felt he should start a NEW thread about it! *smirks*

Anyway... http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/40627-No-one-doing-a-44th-Anniv-Re-enactment-Let-s-all-land-on-the-Mun-this-weekend%21
I plan on doing an Apollo tribute Mun landing Saturday. Going to be my first visit to the Armstrong Memorial, too.

lol dem graphic settings
Yeah I know. This is an old 2007 Dell. I'm surprised it's still even intact the last time I upgraded the video card drivers were in Feb. 2009. I'm currently trying to scrape money together to buy FRAPS and to build a new PC.
Is there no free open source video recording software available?
In Britain the KSPTV marathon begins on the 20th, I'll be watching that.

More pic of my second landing mission but same build with minor tweaks. Rocket on pad:pic.twitter.com/k2Hb2lKzh9In Low-Kerbin orbit, preparing for Trans-Munar burn:pic.twitter.com/4vKNoWkjPt And yes I had to have Infinite RCS because there is no way I can control the craft without it.

Edited July 17, 2013 by XxDaSTaRXx

wasn't the moon landing on the 20th
Uhm, I guess, yeah. But it's the whole celebration. July 16th, the Saturn V and it's crew began their journey. It's kind of a week-round sort of thing.

I plan on doing an Apollo tribute Mun landing Saturday. Going to be my first visit to the Armstrong Memorial, too.
Take screenshots!
